title: 820-00164 Water Damage
message:
Hey guys,

I have a 820-00164 which is giving some problems. Okay so originally it came on with no wifi (not turning on). I checked and PP3v3_WLAN was only 2.64v. I tested this with board still in frame. Took it out the frame and saw corrosion around L4605. Cleaned that and the system wont boot. G3H was only 2v. Changed the ISL and Q7130 then g3H was back to normal but still no power. Noticed the 3.3v line was missing , checked out U7501 and corrosion was on the pins . Changed that now 3.3v is back but still no power. Looked again under the scope and the EFI had some corrosion, I reflowed it and boom fan spin. Feeling all satisfied I put the unit back together to see if WLAN would be back and no power again. Checking PPBUS_G3H in frame I am getting 8.64 volts for 3 secs then it drops to 4v then back to 8.64v in a continuous loop. What can be the problem? Or where should I start?

title: 820-00164 Water Damage
message:
Still corrosion problems.
Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of ISL6259.
Inspect the areas where you applied heat to change components.

title: 820-00164 Water Damage
message: after taking the efi off, cleaning and added fresh solder i have fan spin again out of frame but still fluctuating g3h

title: 820-00164 Water Damage
message: Remove F7140 and check if C7140 voltage is steady.

title: 820-00164 Water Damage
message: C7140 is fluctuating with the F7140 removed

title: 820-00164 Water Damage
message: I am guessing something on the charger side because I have constant voltage on battery.

title: 820-00164 Water Damage
message:
Post U7100 voltages; pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.
Monitor them for fluctuation.
